bee I was half freedom fighter

the art classes were just filled with

artists was mostly shown the ticket of

gain a show because they're busy showing
history
with the opportunity to carry a show of
Sam's work one of the things that came
to mind was the influence of Sam both to
my work and to the times Sam very much
is an artist who I look to an artist
who's living in DC during the Marches
making amazing abstract work it's a
protest in its own the inclusion of the
black artist was often through
representation of the black body the
artists job is to transform that
conversation in Sam's case removing the
canvas from its stretcher and freeing it
it becomes this emancipation
I think that you can discuss the
complexity of one's experience without
illustrating that experience in such a
comprehensive and legible way and I'd
like to create as much complexity and
contradiction as is possible I don't
want to have to participate in the
conversation and I don't want to
necessarily have to be removed from it
to be embraced are considered or
participated with as an artist so I
think that those contradictions exist
and they're incredibly complex and
things that you know I'm negotiating
